title: Micromax IN Note 1 (Green, 64 GB)  (4 GB RAM)

product_specification.In The Box: Handset, Power Adapter (18W), Data Cable, User Manual, Warranty Card
product_specification.Operating Frequency: GSM: B2/B3/B5/B8, UMTS: B1/B5/B8, 4G LTE FDD: B1/B3/B5/B8/B40/B41, 4G LTE TDD: B40
product_specification.Primary Camera Features: 48MP + 5 MP + 2MP + 2MP AI Quad Rear Camera Setup, AF Rear Camera
product_specification.Sensors: Fingerprint, Accelerometer, Gyro, Proximity Sensor, Ambient Light Sensor
product_specification.Other Features: Aluminosilicate Cover Glass, Dual VoLTE Support, 18W Fast Charger, Reverse Charging
product_specification.Warranty Summary: Brand Warranty of 1 Year Available for Mobile and 6 Months for Accessories

product_description.Take Gaming to the Next Level: Featuring the 12 nm octa-core MediaTek Helio G85 processor, this smartphone will ensure that your gaming endeavours are taken a notch higher.
product_description.Quad Camera Set-up: Capture the sights around you, in all their brilliance, with this smartphone’s quad-camera set-up (48 MP + 5 MP + 2 MP + 2 MP).
product_description.Immersive Visual Experience: This smartphone’s edge-to-edge display will ensure that your visual experience is truly delightful.
product_description.5000 mAh Battery: This smartphone comes equipped with a 5000 mAh battery, so you can talk to your loved ones, watch your favourite shows, and more without worrying about the remaining charge.
product_description.Android OS Experience: Enjoy a safe and smooth experience, as this phone facilitates a pure Android OS experience with no ads or Bloatware.
product_description.Google Assistant: You can share commands using your voice, as this smartphone supports the Google Assistant that you can access at the press of a button.
product_description.Bluetooth 5.0: Enjoy seamless wireless connectivity, as this smartphone supports Bluetooth 5.0.

review:
I'm reviewing about after using 20 days. Must Say micromax has made a strong comeback with IN note 1. Will be talking about in sequence manner:-
1. Built quality/quality control:-
Design is superb I suggest green color looks really amazing and beautiful. Buttons are quite good and screen is surprisingly really bright and good. Wifi and Bluetooth connectivity and calling is all excellent.
2. Performance:-
The customized stock android is really smooth with Helio G85 processor.
3. Battery:-
This mobile really outperforms in this section must say battery is damm legit, it lasts for 2 days completely even if use it more a day. Also the fast charging with 18W adapter charges in 25 mins to 50% and 100% in 2hrs(approx).
4.Camera:-
Some of the samples clicked from this phone looks good. Well the nightmode is really amazing and talking about it's AI functioning it comesout really good.

Lastly some cons is that while taking portrait shots it doesn't take a proper portrait. Yes I clicked this pictures after their first updates. So yes this can be fix if they send a further update which will better work on this.

My Opinion is that supporting our brand will be key to them and yes it's in our hand to make it big or not. It will take some time to make it perfect but we can see better improvements if we support them.

Thank You

Display so really good more than enough. Screen size is best in this price segment. Overall looks of the mobile phone is very good. It doesn't feel that you are using a budget phone. It's comes with Type c charging port which offers you a great speed on charging. And the best feature of this device is it it comes with stock Android . Nobody can offer you stock Android in this price. Speaker pretty decent. And face ID feature is is more faster than I expected. Best phone in budget. And please give a try to Micromax.

So I have been using this phone for a week now and here is my thoughts.
I Would be rating according to - value for money.
1) Camera: 4/5 (Photo) 3.5/5 (Video) | It's good for stabilized pics but avg for video. ( Also comes with slow motion)
2) Gaming : 5/5 ( g85 processor & stock Android gives an above avg gaming exp)
3) Battery: 5/5 | in my exp. Full use - 1day . Avg job use - 2 days. Avg light use 3 or more days.
4) Screen : 4/5 ( Not LED, and no l1 support) . 5/5 ( for the best IPS LCD with 1080p)
5)Speakers : above Avg comparing with high end phones

Lets start in detail after use of 3 days:

1 . OS- Yes its base on stock android but not actually a stock android, yes is totally bloatware free but its not the " android one" but overal its good. some feature like "double tap on wakeup screen" (hope they include in next update) i am missing which was in nokia series android phone, call recording also be there, hoping for regular update and some minor bug fixes appreciating team micromax for good phone after long time hope they ll fix minor software changes soon.all the best.
2.camera- Nice in this price range. sample attached here.(macro and boke both sample) some software level upgrade i am expecting
3. battery & charging- battery really nice when i received phone i was 85% it last up to 2 days until 30%
i started charging form 30-91% took approx 2 hours (dont expect vivo oppo type rapid 30% in 15 min.) but yes for 5000mah 2 hours is fair.
(Cable quality and length is good wrt samsung and vivo oppo)
4.gaming- played one round of call of duty approx 20 min. battery stands good. to enable-disable 3 4 finger use you have to modify 3 finger screenshot option in setting
5.speaker,mic,sound quality- its nice speaker is good enough to listen ring in work outer area, mic is good no pronlem while call
6. other- gave 2 layers of screenguard which is realy good by micromax
in end i am expecting this goodexperince wil not change to bad after usage of month.
After usage of over 10 month, IN has not deliver more than 2 updates of security patches and the ceo was claiming the regular update in his video..
Flipkart delivery speed is good.got in 4 days

Micromax in note 1 is not as expected. It is not a good choice to buy. I don't recommend anyone to buy this phone. Quality is poor. Don't buy just because of an Indian brand. This is genuine review. Don't buy.

First thing you will notice, this phone is beautiful looking, all the buttons are well placed, big nice display, back panel is plastic yet finish is really impressive and color is very vibrant.
1. Display- Display is definitely a high point of this phone.It's Full HD display, very nice, colors are good, loaded with screen guard.
2.Camera- Outdoor/daylight photos are really good with great clarity and details. Low light photos are fine, but these are similar to almost all phones in the same price segment. Camera has many filters and variety of modes, definitely a good offering. Front camera is 16mp is quite good. Night mode also works really well.
3.Software-UI is quite good, took few minutes to get adjusted, I believe it will get further improved in the coming updates.
4.Battery-Its a big 5000mph battery,my usage is normal so it lasts for almost 2 days easily for me.
5.Speakers- Speakers are really good, loud and clear much better than my previous Mi phone.

Overall it's a good phone, Big thumbs up from my side, worth buying in this price range. Finally it's our very own Made in India phone.

Well It's my honest review.
I have seen many Youtubers show that the camera is not good enough but I can assure you that this is the best budget camera phone I have ever seen in this range.

Camera is perfect.
Processor is perfect.
Battery is perfect.
No heating issues while charging and play PUBG game.(a little bit heat that is ok).
Screen is perfect. It's bigger than your expectations.
There is no manufacturing error and also the built quality is very fine.
It's smoother and UI is decent.

Charging time is little bit long it takes in between 2-3 hrs. And I think that is justified because I get battery backup upto 1.2-1.5 days.

The wide camera is not good 😔
I didn't get back cover but Micromax told me they will provide me within 7 days.

Micromax IN 5 out of 5.

I am writing this review After 7days of use.
1-Battery Is Awesome you can rely on it Blindly easily gives you 2days battery life.

2-Primary camera is very good, Captures lots of details.Fine tuning is required,through Updates it can be fixed.Wide angle is also good,it will do the JOB. Front camera Supports 1080p FHD recording. 4Star on camera.

3-Display is no doubt Good.you will enjoy the big And Good Quality screen.

4-Software It comes with Android 10-They have promised 2years update.already recieved the 1st update.Which is effective. Multitouch enabled,Front Camera FHD recording & Security update.

5-Helio G85 is a Tested & Trusted Processor go with it.

Updating After 2months use.Till date I have received 2Updates,Lots of improvement in camera function and others i-Time lapse (Both front & Rear camera). ii-EIS in both front & rear camera,Multi touch.December security updates,Also recieved my back cover as promised. They are keeping their words/Promise happy customer

Value for money.

Battery goes on for atleast 2 days if you are not a gamer.

Don't buy back cover separately because it comes with 1 back cover for free.

I rec'd the product & the product seems to be good, however small things could have made it the best (Rating 5)
I) 2.5D hard glass protection over the screen (there is this mental blockage of using branded screen protection... It is creditable that MMX is trying to create its screen protection, but an extra protection would assure the customer in a long way)
II) If you are dispatching a cover, then please mention in the package description.
Also it would have been great, if you could have provided more rounded edge & hardened corner on the cover...
III) The battery software can be improved. For instance in the current scenario it dosen't provide info like when the last charging was done, for how long will the battery last etc...
To be honest, after reading the -ve remarks (due to the problem of initial batch) I was in a bit of dilemma, whether to purchase the phone or not, but glad that I took the plunge...
The phone appears to be well built, not sturdy but I think the built can be comparable to that of other smartphone built in similar budget.
The software is breeze, actually awesome... Yes there are minor issue but MMX is releasing updates frequently to make it more smooth.
Overall, if you ask me, go for it without any prejudice. Trust me you will not regret...

First of all Congratulations to Micromax for its wonderful comeback with IN series phones.

Some of the Pros and Cons after about 1 week usage

Pros
1. Large Full HD screen. Works good in outdoor sunlight also.
2. Massive 5000 mAh battery. Lasts more than a day with normal usage like call, msg, watching videos, surfing internet etc. I am not a heavy gamer so playing high end games is not my thing.
3. Good Rear camera. 48 mp quad camera is actually good (U have to install updates for good photos).
4. 4 gb Ram and Helio G85 processor is good for Lag free experience and also smooth running of FAU-G game.
5. Near stock android without any bloatware and smooth UI.
6. 18 W fast charging is good. Take less than or almost 2 hrs for 0 to 100% charge. Charger is included in box.
7. Transparent decent back cover in box
8. 2 years promised security and OS updates.
9. Fingerprint sensor in the back works well.
10. Speaker grill is at the bottom and is pretty loud and clear. (Don't expect bass at this price range. Sound is good but flat).

Cons.
1. 16mp front camera is not good. It produces pretty bad images. Hope they fix it in their next update.
2. Low light photo by back camera is also not upto the mark.
3. Phone heats quite a bit after 15 mins of playing FAU-G though the heating was not high but cant ignore also.

Didn't find any other issue. Will update after 1 month usage.

Verdict: Apart from the front camera and low light photography issue the phone excels in all the other aspects be it lag free performance or long battery life. I would definitely recommend others to buy it.
Tip: Do fix a screen guard to prevent any damage or scratches on the screen in the long term.

I'm writing this review after 3 days of usage. I am using this as my secondary phone the other one is Samsung.
The Stock Like UI( Yes it's not stock but close to stock) is looking good however bugs are present here and there. Screen is good with good viewing angle and colour reproduction is also good. Battery backup is excellent and I'm not facing long charging time issue. Though the overall UI is clean and simple but the camera UI is made complicated and slow. Pictures from the main Camera(48MP) is good. But the other 2 cameras (Ultrawide and macro) are useless due to low resolution (5MP+2MP), selfie camera is okay. Micromax removed the pre-installed screen protector from new phones and included a case which is great but make sure you buy a scren protector from day 1. Call quality is good and internet speed is also good. Speaker is decent. Fingerprint reader is pretty fast. Micromax promised 2 years of security update, let's see if they can keep this promise. And last but not the least previously Micromax had a bad reputation in after sales service now it's high time that they don't repeat the same mistake and also expand their service centres in Tire-I cities.

This is mobile is too good, at first I was in dilemma between this and redmi note 10, but I stick with this product as a support for Indian product and risking it thinking as average product but guess what it turns out to be really good phone. Camera it's okayish, it's fine for the price tag of that amount, ram is good and big enough, battery is something I am amazed ,in my last phone redmi note 7 , while gaming like cod and pubg it used to drain realy fast, but this mobile amazed me that I was able to play full day and still left with 10%
, also the most important part is the cpu, microtek G85 is so much improved , couldn't find lag in classic and most of the custom rooms (exception during competetive last zone matches) I used to play although the gyro was slight sluggish but you get used to it. I can definitely say it's overall best phone for gaming for that tag, although I didn't try note 10 but I am happy with this product as it fulfilled my everyday needs

I loved the Phone, well crafted solid body accompanied with a back case Idea for Business And Personal usage upto now no lags or any hanging issue.

While charging it getting a bit heat.

Clearcut review:
1. Heat up during changing. When you start charging it charge fast and mobile heat up terribly and reach 50-55 degree. After sometime it gear down charging and heating also reduce. But it do not overheat during use.

Update: had manufacturing defect, problem solved by service center, and service is better then anyone. Now no heating issue.

2. Can't do Offline video calling as it is stock android.

3. It has 4 carrier aggregation, connect 4 band at al time. I tried on jio.

4. Fingerprint sensor need improvement, sometimes it says doesn't match and next attempt open. It do not work if finger is wet. But face unlock fast. Fingerprint is not an issue to reject this phone, it's quite manageable.

5. No such quality issue In built I have seen, I have White one and back pannel is also good, no such major issues like people says it can be pressed from back, yes but 1mm. It is not noticeable or you can't feel it while using.

6. Display is awesome, I love the design and specially center punch hole. I did not want to buy nutch display it look old fashion. And had little budget constraint so I bought it.

7. InFront camera is really good. Back camera is also good take good picture and good colour balance, It is after the latest camera update. In this range It has the best camera.

Conclusion: Heating during changing is a big issue. It will damage phone in long run. I am thinking of buying a 10w charger. Hence I am giving it 1star. If they fix it I will change my openion.
Update: All issue got resolved, It's a must buy product.

You can find all the positive points in the 5 star reviews, and they are not wrong but here I will be telling you only the negative points due to which you may want to skip this and purchase some other phone as these points can be a deal breaker for some.

1 the charger provided with the phone is a 18w charger and it heats up the phone very badly everytime so I have to use 10w charger of my old phone

2 it is Missing Widevine L1 certificate which is necessary for viewing HD content (ie above 480p quality) in Netflix, prime etc. Which is very bad considering it has full HD 1080p display but sadly it can't be used

3 there is a Google Assistant button on the left side of the phone which gets pressed accidentally when we are viewing videos in horizontal mode and the phone is kept on the table and that is very irritating as it disturbs us

4 the battery life is not very good despite 5000Mah and lasts less than 1 day

Now I decided to keep this phone as I was having urgent need and no alternative phone had been selected by me
But if you have a second choice then please consider above negatives before purchasing IN NOTE 1.

I waited for this phone for 2 months because I didn't want to buy a Chinese phone and I've had micromax phone in the past which worked great for years.

I heard many good reviews about this phone but after buying it I faced issue with its magnetometer sensor (used to tell direction in compass). It was not working as expected, also there was problem with charging. The charging was very slow, it took 10 hours for it to fully charge from 10% to 100%. I thought it was because phone was new, I tried charing the second time, and still the problem was there.

Then I asked for replacement but even after the replacement there was the same problem. The compass was telling wrong direction even after calibrating it for many hours. The charging issue was also present in the new phone. Unfortunately I had to ask for refund because I can't manage with slow charing and compass showing wrong direction in a brand new phone. I hope Micromax will fix it soon. Otherwise the phone is awesome, that's why the 3 stars.

The phone design and aesthetic is very similar to most popular smartphone brands. I purchased the white colour and this is a classic in terms of the looks. Clear pearl look. The phone software is clean and neat with no bloatware. This is an absolute peach from Micromax. I have used several micromax phones earlier in the manufacturing. This is a bang and out of th ebox device. The display brightness is awesome even in outdoor conditions. The touch sensitivity is amazing. The fingerprint reader is heaven with the haptic feedback. It works magic in the price segment that the phone was released. Micromax should do much better in the coming years. Couple of negatives - could have provided the call recording option in the software itself; next is the display is a little bit bigger and my fingers are smaller. Worth every penny you pay for. Terrific competitor for all the Chinese phones.

Micromax has made a great comeback with this phone,
After using for 3 months here's pro and cons
PROs
1. Processor, it's the best you can get at this price. Can handle heavy games and multi-tasking with ease.
2. Screen: It's definitely not the best lcd panel but still a FHD panel at this price.
3. Camera is decent little desaturations in color processing but still doable
4. Battery
5.Price: yes in Note 1 is priced very competitively It's absolute value for money device.

Cons
1. Storage: storage is Little slow and can't keep up with the processor but that's hardly noticed
2. Build could've been better.

Overall it's a great buy, a little more ram could've been nice.

I am messaging from in note 1 mobile. After so many days usage I thought that at this range you don't want to buy this mobile. Before buying due to nice reviews. But when I compared with other mobile this is waste .

My experience:
1)When I compared with 4000mah battery phone both are giving same back up time. Then what is the difference between 4000mah and 5000mah.

2)The camera also not good. Saying that this is 48mp camera, when I compared with 13mp old mobile both are having clarity. This is not good

3)Before buying in micromax official they said that this mobile will get regular updates for improving bugs and other issues. But from so many months only two updates came and the security patch date is May 2021.Then where is the protection for the mobile without security patch updates.

NOTE:-
The 18w fast charging is bogus.6000mah battery phone is charging fastly with only 10w charger.But this is much worse.

I advise to buy another company mobile if it still continues.

1) eye caching design

3) better performence

Cones

4) Fast charging is not work properly. After 80 or 85 % of charge it stop fast charging automatically.

The phone is awesome in this price segment. I listing down both pros and cons.

Pros:-
1) Stock android clean UI
2) Punch Hole display
3) Full Hd plus display at this price range
4) Quad Camera Setup
5) Large battery lasts for a day in normal usage.
6) Type C charger

Cons:-

1) Software optimisation in terms of camera and other apps are required. Though latest updates have tried to solve many of them.

2) The fingerprint sensor feels slightly upwards if device held normally.

3) Slight heating while charging but after latest update there is no issue.

4) I faced some issue with the proximity sensor initially like it was unable to lock screen while I was speaking on a call. but now it's fine.


3)

Its been two months since I am using this phone. I wanted to purchase an Indian brand and I searched multiple options for couple of weeks before finalizing this model. I am not a heavy user, it is basic use for calls, email, whatsapp, photos and normal utility apps. It works very well and I have not faced any issue with performance so far. Display is brilliant, sound is crystal clear and touch is very responsive. Camera is really good with good amount of clarity in photos. Biggest plus is that there is no adware/bloatware, it is clean Android experience. There was heating issue while charging but that has been fixed in May-21 update. Waiting for Android 11...

Overall, a very good phone under 12000 price range. Go for it!

Writing review after using for a month..
Pros
1. It's having a good quality full hd display which is adequately bright and also has night light feature with dark theme.
2. Stock android is a very clean experience.
3. It's powered by a fast Helio G85 processor which can do all your tasks easily.
4. It's battery is good and lasts for a day easily for normal usage.
5. It's camera is good at this price point(After first system update, it improved a lot).

Cons
1. Does not have support for 1080p for streaming services.
2. Night mode gives good colour but makes the photo a bit too noisy.

As it is an Indian brand, also because of stock android experience, it's a great smartphone at this price.

#InforIndia... The In Note 1 is much better than other smartphones in the same price range. It has 5000 mAh battery that gets charged in approximately five to six hours. It has a great backup. For normal usage (excluding heavy gaming) it lasts more than 12 hours. The rear camera is better but needs more updates. But the selfie camera needs updates much more than the rear one. The picture quality of the front camera is better when beauty mode is enabled but without it the camera has dull performance. Other minor bugs and tiny stutters that are very unnoticeable and can be ignored while using apps and other functions of the phone. I hope with new updates the Micromax India adds much more new features with regular updates for making our experience more smooth and easier. Thank you Flipkart for your delivery in 2 days. And for those who are still worried regarding this phone, I assure you that Micromax In series won't upset you. #GoInForIndia.

In note 1 was the product for me at a budget range. Is this the best budget phone at 10k - 15k range? may be not, it is not the only one at its segment. But is it the best value for money? certainly yes, specially the 4gb, 64gb variant. There were some issues with quality control when the model was released. But the developers kept there promise. My handset felt tight and durable, finish was smooth and it came with a nice transparent back cover. The phone performance wise felt smooth and snappy. Often reviewer said the camera was not optimized. However, after use I found the camera quality to be very realistic and it flaws in my photography subject does not vanish away post processing like some other device on the market(you know which one I am talking about). The Stock android is a bonus and I like my hand set clean.Speaker sound quality was loud and ok if not great. The dual sim cum memory slot and headphone jack was a life saver. Now lets come to the flaws. The HDR and night mode photo post processing will take few milliseconds or seconds extra, not that it is noticeable but if one is very particular about those things they should know. Battery charging for me was fast enough and it took 1:30 hours to 1:45 hours to charge from 41% to 100%. Since I charge my phone at night post my office it is okay enough for me. However, battery drain I found is a bit much as after 5 - 6 hours of on and off usage (some you tube vids, some mails, some music playing on Bluetooth music system was done not continuously but after several breaks) it lost 12% of battery. I personally think the drain is a bit higher than its competitors (however at a medium usage it should still last a day or near day and be charged when the user is at sleep or something). Having said that these are software optimization issues and the battery drain, HDR, Night mode photo processing could be addressed with updates.
All in all Micromax in Note 1 try to give its consumer taste of every thing (a good gaming processor, stock android/snappy experience, realistic photo quality, dual sim/memory slot and 3.5 jack and a good loud speaker to blast your favorite song on the go) while not being the king of only one or two aspect(s) at the price range of merely 11000 rs. Frankly this is for me Asus max pro series on steroids and Asus max pro series was a beast and cost lesser than its competitors. This is one hell of a value for money phone and even if you are planning to go for 5g within coming 1.5 to 2 years but need one 4g phone now, pocket pinch and value concerned, this one 4g phone you wont regret as it is cheaper than its competitors and gives the ability to do every handset oriented task in a pretty satisfactory manner.
If how developers responded to quality control, can respond to the software optimization in a same way (which they have already promised for 2 coming rears, another), I will gladly look forward to Micromax's desi flagship 5G edition too.

Been using the phone over a week now, the phone performs well and has awesome battery life. The Android experience is stock and bloatware free. It has already got November security patch with few bug fixes. Phone looks modern and stylish especially in the green colour. Now few things which could be improved, I got a dead charger out of the box so better quality control is required for accessories too. Though I went to Micromax service center and got it replaced within 30mins. So that's good. Camera quality is average and I am certain that it can improved via software update. Camera UI and Gallery application is outdated, again not a big issue but things can certainly change with a software update. Overall I am very satisfied with the phone.

Misinformations -
1. Battery takes too long to charge

2. Bad build quality
A: The build quality was bad in a very small first batch. My unit has solid build quality.

A: No such problems reported.

- The phone is only supported for 2 years of updates. Hope they extend it to 3.

Let us divide this review in pros and cons.
Pros:
1. Awesome camera : I have used redmi note 9 for a few weeks so I know its camera performance which is just above average and for some reason I was expecting less from micromax, but when I checked its camera, it was really impressive considering the pricing of the phone. It shoots good quality photos with impressive details during daylight but it struggles at night when there is absence of light. The front camera is good and shoots some nice photos.
2. Bigger battery : The 5000 mAh battery will last upto 18-20 hrs under normal usage, upto 11 hrs with always screen on option and about 7 hrs while playing games like COD, freefire, etc. It does not heat while playing heavy games like COD
3. Screen : I personally like the 6.67 inch massive screen the screen is not overly saturated or blue tinted and I must tell you micromax has used some really good panels on their smartphones. The is responsive and produce some accurate colours.
4. Clean UI : Its pretty rare to see a bloatware free phone in this price segment (except for Nokia). Micromax has advertised it as pure android but i must tell you that it is not really pure android, they have added some features like intelligent gaming and customized icons senn in quick settings bar.
5. Speakers : In note 1 ships with a single loud speaker which is quite loud and impressive to hear songs and play games.

Cons:
1. Built quality : The phone's back panel is made up of some sort of poly carbonated plastic, side buttons are also made up of plastic and is poorly attached to the plastic main frame. They are loosely attached and can fell from the phone in future. Overall I was not impressed with the overall build quality. Micromax should check on this issue in their upcoming devices. Overall I will give 3/5 for built quality.
2. Operating system : Micromax should really look into their android based OS. While using I noticed some lag while switching between apps, the camera app's UI is so simple and they have some outdated Gallery app installed in the phone. When the phone is switched to light theme instead of Dark theme, for some reason gallery app still remains in the dark themed background, Also if you enabled the three finger screenshot gesture you cannot use the phone using three fingers or more and if used (like when playing games) the whole screen freezes. Overall they are all minor problems and can be fixed by rolling out an update.

Overall, I must say that Micromax is off to a good start and now I am willing to see that they really work on the promised 2 years of software updates and security patches. Really hoping that Micromax will Dominate the Budget and Mid range smartphone market.

pros.Performance: The MediaTek Helio G85 processor is superfast and gives a smooth and seamless experience.
pros.5000 mAh Battery: The 5000 mAh battery gives long lasting life and usually lasts for more than 2 days on normal use.
pros.Sound: This phone sports an amazing speaker quality with loud and clear audio.
pros.16.94 cm (6.67 inch) Full HD+ IPS Infini: The full HD display of this phone gives detailed visual experience with its vibrant colors.
pros.Camera: The quad-camera set-up of 48 MP + 5 MP + 2 MP + 2 MP is very good and captures a lot of details. Front camera supports 1080p FHD recording.

cons.Glitches: Some minor glitches which can be improved.

summary.verdict: The Micromax IN Note 1 is an awesome pick in this price segment.
summary.Additional Information: Dual Sim, Supports screen recording, 18W charger.
